ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: that this is the word of a noble Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: because the Quran is certainly the word of a reverent messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: This Qur’an is the speech of Allah with a gracious Noble Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That this is verily the word of an honored Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely, it is the Word brought by an honored Apostle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: it is the speech of a noble Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: most surely, this is the word brought by a noble messenger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That it is surely the speech brought by messenger honourable.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That this is verily the word of an honoured Messenger [i.e. Jibrael (Gabriel) or Muhammad SAW which he has brought from Allah].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: that this is the speech of a noble Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is the speech of a noble messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:40] it, that is to say, the Qur’ān, is indeed the speech of a noble messenger, in other words, he has spoken it as a message from God, exalted be He.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That it) i.e. the Qur'an (is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger) He says: the Qur'an is the Word of Allah which Gabriel brought down to an illustrious messenger, i.e. Muhammad (pbuh).
